data.name: Business Overdraft (residential secured)
data.description: A Great Southern Bank Business overdraft can help you to closely manage your cashflow without compromising your business goals.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Loan purpose must be business related.
Applicant/s Guarantors must be a legal entity registered within Australia.
All individuals, directors, guarantors, trustees, members must be 18+ yrs.
All individuals, directors, guarantors, trustees, members must be an Australian Resident.
Applications for Overdrafts are subject to credit approval. Property offered as security must be acceptable within policy.

features.additionalInfo: Once approved the overdraft limit is loaded on to an Everyday Business Account.
No overdraft service fees.  With no annual or monthly service fees you can save money for the other important things in your life.

fees.name: Establishment fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 irrespective of loan amount.  An establishment fee includes the cost of processing the application and the preparation of loan documentation.

fees.name: Securities Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For each security offrered to Great Southern Bank for the overdraft.

fees.name: Debt Collection Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Costs incurred in the recovery of outstanding debts vary depending on the nature of the default.  These costs are applied by the Solicitors or independent contractors engaged to undertake action to recover the funds and are debited to the account that is out of order.

fees.name: Production Fee
fees.additionalInfo: If a title held by Great Southern Bank has to be presented to the state's land titles office for any purpose.

fees.name: Arrears letter fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable where Great Southern Bank sends you a letter in relation to arrears on your account.

fees.name: Property Valuation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable upfront where an independent property valuer nominated by Great Southern Bank must provide a market value the security property offered.

fees.name: Default notice fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable where Great Southern Bank sends you a default notice in relation to arrears or an over limit amount on your account.

fees.name: Overlimit Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Where the balance on the Everyday Business Account exceeds the authorised overdraft limit.

fees.name: Redocumentation or Variation  Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if the security held for the overdraft is to be substituted for another property.

fees.name: Discharge Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the security held for the overdraft is to be released and the overdraft limit removed from the Everyday Business transaction account.
